SADISTIC.Definition: enjoying hurting or making others suffer

DESPOT.Definition: a ruler with total power who was often cruel

HIDDEN GEM.Definition: a place or thing that is great but not well known

INEVITABLY.Definition: in a way that it is certain to happen or cannot be avoided

COMPELLED.Definition: having to do it, because they feel it is necessary

TOURIST TRAIL.Definition: popular places that many visitors went to

ARISTOCRATS.Definition: rich and powerful people from noble families

MINDING THEIR OWN BUSINESS.Definition: not bothering others, just focussing on themselves

NEW LEASE OF LIFE.Definition: a fresh start or renewed energy

PLATTER.Definition: a large plate for serving food

SULTAN.Definition: a ruler in some Muslim countries in the past

MONOLITHIC.Definition: uniform, united, and difficult to change

AUTONOMY.Definition: the right to rule or make decisions by themselves

FAR-FLUNG.Definition: very far away or spread out

NOBLE.Definition: belonging to a high social rank

INSTILLED.Definition: put the idea or feeling into his mind over time

RUTHLESSNESS.Definition: showing no mercy, being very cruel to get what you want

INHERITED.Definition: received from parents or past generations

CLANS.Definition: large family groups with a shared past

INTIMIDATING.Definition: making people feel scared or nervous

ENFORCER.Definition: someone who made sure rules or orders were followed, often using force

REVOLTS.Definition: attempts by people to fight against authority

ANOMALY.Definition: something that was different from what was normal

HOME-GROWN.Definition: made or developed in his own country

CONSOLIDATING.Definition: making it stronger and more stable

CUNNING.Definition: smart in a tricky or sneaky way

CROSSROADS.Definition: a place where two roads met

WARLORD.Definition: a leader who controlled the area using force

ALLY.Definition: a friend or supporter in war

COUNTERBALANCE.Definition: something that would have an equal but opposite effect on it

PLAYED THEM OFF.Definition: made them fight each other for his own benefit

HIERARCHY.Definition: a ranking of positions of authority

CUTTING DEALS.Definition: making agreements in a secret way

MANIPULATING.Definition: controlling in a clever, often dishonest way

DROWNED.Definition: killed by keeping them underwater too long

HUB.Definition: a centre of activity or a place where many things connected

PARADOX.Definition: something that seemed impossible but was actually true

PEERS.Definition: people of the same age and status

WELL-TRODDEN.Definition: used or visited by many people

EXOTIC.Definition: unusual or from a faraway place

ANTIQUITY.Definition: ancient times or things from long ago

EAGER.Definition: very excited and wanting to do it

ELITE.Definition: people with high social class, nobility

NOTORIOUS.Definition: well known, famous for something bad

INTERTWINED.Definition: were closely connected or twisted together

INTRIGUE.Definition: secret plans, tricks, or interest in something mysterious

STABLE.Definition: not likely to change, strong and steady

THE FINAL STRAW.Definition: the last small problem that led to a big reaction

DEFIANCE.Definition: a daring or bold resistance to authority, opposition

SIEGE.Definition: surrounding the place to capture it

SPARK.Definition: start or cause it to happen

ALLIES.Definition: people or groups that supported him

ABANDONED.Definition: left him behind or gave up on him

TURNING THE TABLES ON.Definition: changing the situation to gain the upper hand

FORTIFIED.Definition: provided with defensive works as protection against attack

CITADEL.Definition: a strong castle that protected the city

IRONED OUT.Definition: decided by solving problems, removing differences, or taking care of details

UNDER THE PRETEXT OF.Definition: using them as a false reason

CLAIMED.Definition: said it was true without proof

FLASHING.Definition: shining in a bright but brief, sudden way

BARRICADING.Definition: blocking the place to stop people from getting in

MORTALLY.Definition: in a way that caused death

TROPHY.Definition: something kept as a prize or proof of success

DEFYING.Definition: openly resisting or refusing to obey

SLAMMED.Definition: hit or banged it with great force

EFFICIENTLY.Definition: in an organised and successful way
